intro: Cryptobasis regelii, commonly known as the Regel's cryptobasis, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late summer. Cryptobasis regelii is often found in rocky or arid habitats, where it has adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and fragile ecosystem, it is considered a vulnerable species.
